meanings.definition: Relating to the study of the effects of low temperatures on living organisms.
meanings.sent1: The cryobiological research team discovered how cold temperatures affect tiny creatures.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use cryobiological techniques to understand how freezing impacts different animals.
meanings.sent3: The cryobiological experts were so cold in the lab that they started wearing extra sweaters.
meanings.sent4: Her fascination with cryobiological studies was as icy and deep as the frozen Arctic Ocean.
meanings.sent5: The cryobiological experiments painted a frosty picture of nature's resilience in extreme cold.

meanings.definition: Involving the preservation of biological material through freezing.
meanings.sent1: The cryobiological method helped keep the cells intact during the freezing process.
meanings.sent2: Frozen food companies rely on cryobiological techniques to maintain the quality of their products.
meanings.sent3: The cryobiological approach to storing organs in ice made the freezer look like a hospital.
meanings.sent4: His cryobiological strategy for preserving flowers in ice was a chilling success.
meanings.sent5: The cryobiological preservation of seeds in ice showcased nature's ability to withstand extreme conditions.
